title: Google\Cloud\Optimization\V1\ShipmentRoute\Transition
name: Transition
description:
Transition between two events on the route. See the description of [ShipmentRoute][google.cloud.optimization.v1.ShipmentRoute].

If the vehicle does not have a start_location and/or end_location, the corresponding travel metrics are 0.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.optimization.v1.ShipmentRoute.Transition

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.travel_duration
params.description: Travel duration during this transition.

params.name: data.travel_distance_meters
params.description: Distance traveled during the transition.

params.name: data.traffic_info_unavailable
params.description: When traffic is requested via [OptimizeToursRequest.consider_road_traffic] [google.cloud.optimization.v1.OptimizeToursRequest.consider_road_traffic], and the traffic info couldn't be retrieved for a Transition, this boolean is set to true. This may be temporary (rare hiccup in the realtime traffic servers) or permanent (no data for this location).

params.name: data.delay_duration
params.description: Sum of the delay durations applied to this transition. If any, the delay starts exactly delay_duration seconds before the next event (visit or vehicle end). See [TransitionAttributes.delay][google.cloud.optimization.v1.TransitionAttributes.delay].

params.name: data.break_duration
params.description: Sum of the duration of the breaks occurring during this transition, if any. Details about each break's start time and duration are stored in [ShipmentRoute.breaks][google.cloud.optimization.v1.ShipmentRoute.breaks].

params.name: data.wait_duration
params.description: Time spent waiting during this transition. Wait duration corresponds to idle time and does not include break time. Also note that this wait time may be split into several non-contiguous intervals.

params.name: data.total_duration
params.description: Total duration of the transition, provided for convenience. It is equal to: next visit start_time (or vehicle_end_time if this is the last transition) - this transition's start_time; if ShipmentRoute.has_traffic_infeasibilities is false, the following additionally holds: total_duration = travel_duration + delay_duration + break_duration + wait_duration.

params.name: data.start_time
params.description: Start time of this transition.

params.name: data.route_polyline
params.description: The encoded polyline representation of the route followed during the transition. This field is only populated if [populate_transition_polylines] [google.cloud.optimization.v1.OptimizeToursRequest.populate_transition_polylines] is set to true.

params.name: data.vehicle_loads
params.description: Vehicle loads during this transition, for each type that either appears in this vehicle's [Vehicle.load_limits][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Vehicle.load_limits], or that have non-zero [Shipment.load_demands][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Shipment.load_demands] on some shipment performed on this route. The loads during the first transition are the starting loads of the vehicle route. Then, after each visit, the visit's load_demands are either added or subtracted to get the next transition's loads, depending on whether the visit was a pickup or a delivery.

params.name: data.loads
params.description: Deprecated: Use [Transition.vehicle_loads][] instead.

methods.name: getTotalDuration
methods.description:
Total duration of the transition, provided for convenience. It is equal to:

  • next visit start_time (or vehicle_end_time if this is the last transition) - this transition's start_time;
  • if ShipmentRoute.has_traffic_infeasibilities is false, the following additionally holds: `total_duration = travel_duration + delay_duration
  • break_duration + wait_duration`.

Generated from protobuf field .google.protobuf.Duration total_duration = 7;

methods.name: getVehicleLoads
methods.description:
Vehicle loads during this transition, for each type that either appears in this vehicle's [Vehicle.load_limits][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Vehicle.load_limits], or that have non-zero [Shipment.load_demands][google.cloud.optimization.v1.Shipment.load_demands] on some shipment performed on this route.

The loads during the first transition are the starting loads of the vehicle route. Then, after each visit, the visit's load_demands are either added or subtracted to get the next transition's loads, depending on whether the visit was a pickup or a delivery.

Generated from protobuf field map<string, .google.cloud.optimization.v1.ShipmentRoute.VehicleLoad> vehicle_loads = 11;

The loads during the first transition are the starting loads of the vehicle route. Then, after each visit, the visit's load_demands are either added or subtracted to get the next transition's loads, depending on whether the visit was a pickup or a delivery.
